description: Least prime p such that p+2n is also prime.
comments: It is conjectured that a(n) always exists. a(n) has been computed for n < 5*10^11, with largest value a(248281210271)=3307. - _Jens Kruse Andersen_, Nov 28 2004
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
J. K. Andersen, Prime gaps (not necessarily consecutive), Yahoo! group "primenumbers", Nov 26 2004.
formula: If a(n) exists, a(n) < 2n, which of course is a great overestimate. - _T. D. Noe_, Jul 16 2002a(n) = A087711(n) - n. - _Zak Seidov_, Nov 28 2007a(n) = A020484(n)-2n. - _Zak Seidov_, May 29 2014
